title: Mike Perry on Clay Street
location_description: The mural exists on a building at the corner of Clay and Melindy in Over-the-Rhine (OTR), an area in Cincinnati believed to be the largest, most intact urban historic district in the United States.
artist_biography: Mike Perry is a Brooklyn-based designer and artist working in numerous media: books, magazines, films, newspapers. Some of his clients include Apple, The New York Times, Target and Nike. In 2008, he was awarded the esteemed New Visual artist award by Print magazine. In addition to his artwork, Perry has published extensively.

origin_description: Mike Perry designed and created this mural while in Cincinnati with Naomi Reis for their exhibit Night and Day at the YES Gallery.
associations: The mural on Clay and Melindy was created in association with the YES Gallery in OTR.

title: Revival
location_description: The mural exists on the side of the headquarters of Roadtrippers, one of Cincinnati’s fastest-growing startup companies. The mural is a seven-minute walk from the historic Findlay Market.
artist_biography: Keith Neltner is a veteran of the arts and crafts (brewing) scenes around Cincinnati. For over fifteen years, Keith has worked at and with local design firms like Landor, LPK, and Possible. Keith is the chief operator and designer at Neltner Small Batch, a Cincinnati design from located down the road from the farm where he grew up.
subject_description: Revival is an artistic crowning of Cincinnati as the Queen City of brewing. It celebrates the contributions that brewing has brought to the city, and the opportunities it brings for its future. The mural now acts as a dramatic gateway for visitors into Cincinnati’s Brewery District.
origin_description: Revival was designed by artist Keith Neltner (of Neltner Small Batch), and was executed by a team of fifteen artists and youth apprentices through Cincinnati’s ArtWorks public art initiative.
associations: Revival was created through the Cincinnati ArtWorks initiative, in partnership with the Brewery District Community Redevelopment Corporation.

title: Ode to a Tagger
location_description: Located inside of the parking lot between the Art Academy of Cincinnati and the Know Theatre of Cincinnati, one block east of the Ensemble Theatre in Over-the-Rhine, Cincinnati.
artist_biography: Higher Level Art is a collective of artists specializing in murals and exhibition art. HLA have completed many client pieces as well as public arts projects. Their work has appeared in skateparks, classrooms, and even vehicles. See their works at http://www.higherlevelart.com.
subject_description: Ode to a Tagger is a complex and fascinating expression of pop, urban, and consumer cultures. The full-scale mural depicts a large Goldebergesque construction of objects brought together in unison through semi-logical relationships, and the works’ bright palette.
origin_description: Ode to a Tagger was painted by Higher Level Art, an artistic collective based in Greater Cincinnati. It was the seventh mural done by the group for the Know Theatre.
associations: The mural was created during OTR’s 11th annual Fringe Festival, a twelve-day performing arts event held in Cincinnati in 2014.

title: XYZ Axis
location_description: The mural exists on Clay Street in Over-the-Rhine, an area in Cincinnati that has seen rapid development since the early 2000’s.
artist_biography: Matt Moore, who is based in Portland, Maine, is a mural artist and graphic designer with a background in action board sports and the action art of graffiti. As founder of MWM Graphics, he has named his digital abstract style “Vectorfunk”. Leaving himself open to the inspiration of new places, materials, and looming deadlines, for the majority of his projects with art galleries, he arrives to the venue empty-handed, creating the entire body of work as a residency on-site, whether in Paris or Cincinnati.

title: The Golden Muse
location_description: The mural Overlooks the Emanuel Center parking lot at 13th & Race, across the street of Washington Park in Over-the-Rhine, Cincinnati.
artist_biography: Tim Parsley is a Summa Cum Laude BFA graduate from the University of Cincinnati’s College of DAAP. Tim has served part-time as a project manager for Cincinnati’s ArtWorks mural initiative and a crew member at the Contemporary Arts Center. Tim currently also serves as Assistant Director of the Manifest Drawing Center Studio in East Walnut Hills.
subject_description: The Golden Muse is a full-sized wall mural depicting the eponymous female afflatus holding her stylus and parchment, spawning ribbons of musical notes which flow around her figure and reach out to the viewer.
origin_description: The Golden Muse was painted by artist and educator Tim Parsley, supported by a team of ArtWorks apprentices and teaching assistants.
associations: This mural was created through the Cincinnati ArtWorks initiative, as part of the Taft Museum’s 80th Anniversary Celebration, titled “Art for All”.

title: Global Warning
location_description: This mural is installed on a East-facing red brick exterior wall of the 150-year-old Arnold’s Bar and Grill, Cincinnati’s oldest tavern.
artist_biography: This Los Angeles-based artist trained at the prestigious Rhode Island School of Design and has become one of the most well-known street artists for appropriating images from mass media.

origin_description: As part of his exhibit at the Contemporary Arts Center, Supply and Demand, Fairey put up murals on the exterior of seven buildings in OTR, downtown and Northside.
associations: Shepard Fairey created this exterior mural in association with its host, Arnold’s Bar and Grill, and the Contemporary Arts Center, which brought Fairey to Cincinnati and mounted his museum exhibition entitled Supply and Demand.

title: Ice Cream Daydream
location_description: This mural is located on the west-facing wall of the historic Germania building, at the corner of Jackson and 12th streets in Cincinnati’s rapidly growing Gateway Quarter.
artist_biography: Amanda Checco graduated from Miami University and earned her graduate degree in Fine Arts from the University of Cincinnati. She is a Cincinnati-based artist and educator who frequently participates in international artist exchange programs. Her bold artwork a penchant for pop culture, vibrant colors, yoga and Eastern mysticism.

associations: Ice Cream Daydream was created in association with P&G, Robin and Mu Sinclaire, The Otto M. Budig Family Foundation, Jacob G. Schmidlapp Trusts and Fifth Third Bank.

title: Get Up
location_description: Get Up is a boldly colored mural on the side of a 4-story red brick building in the Pendleton district of Cincinnati, at the intersection of 12th Street and Pendleton and Reading Roads.
artist_biography: Maser studied Visual Communication at Art School in Ireland, began painting graffiti in Dublin in 1995, and has become a leading visual artist working in urban environments. He had painted went on to walls in countries throughout Europe and in the U.S., and more recently has completed works on canvas, in video, and in large-scale 3D installations.

associations: The mural was done in association with AGAR, a Cincinnati company that creates immersive experiences to link brands and consumers.

title: The Singing Mural
location_description: The Singing Mural is painted on the two-story South wall of the Town Center Garage on Central Parkway, home to the operations of WCET-TV.
artist_biography: C.F. Payne is an artist-illustrator whose artwork has graced the covers of Time Magazine, The New York Times Sunday Magazine, U.S. News and World Report, The Atlantic Monthly and many more. He has been commissioned to paint countless politicians, authors and entertainers, and has illustrated ten children’s books. His artwork has been exhibited at numerous museums including The Cincinnati Art Museum, The National Portrait Gallery, and The Norman Rockwell Museum, as well as numerous college and university galleries.

origin_description: C. F. Payne’s colorful characters in this mural represent an ode to the Queen City’s rich arts and cultural legacy. Included are Cincinnati arts patron Patricia Corbett, Sesame Street’s Grover, the Phantom from Phantom of the Opera, rock artist Elton John, opera singer Beverly Sills, a euphonium player to represent Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra, jazz singer Cab Calloway, and many others.
associations: The Singing Mural was created and installed in association with the Cincinnati Opera, WCET, and Cincinnati’s ArtWorks, whose collaborators included Project Manager Jenny Ustick, three teaching assistants and fifteen youth apprentices.

title: Untitled (Unframed)
location_description: This mural is installed on a red brick wall in the interior courtyard of the 150-year-old Arnold’s Bar and Grill, Cincinnati’s oldest tavern.
artist_biography: The anonymous JR began pasting photographs in Paris train stations in 2001, and moved on to create large installations comprised of thousands of poster-size portraits plastered on public buildings and infrastructure around the world. In 2011, he was awarded the TED Prize for helping to spark global change, by drawing public attention to social injustice.
origin_description: In his Unframed series of murals, which began in 2010, JR uses photographs, old or new, cropped or enlarged, to jog the collective memory of a city's history and to empower and humanize his subjects – often disenfranchised and alienated – by pasting their pictures to the infrastructure of their often-impoverished environment.
associations: JR created this mural in association with its host, Arnold’s Bar and Grill, and the Contemporary Arts Center, which brought JR to Cincinnati and mounted his first solo museum exhibition during the time this mural was created.

title: The Hands That Built Our City
